job_description:
• Experience with Power Sequencing, PCIe, USB, JTAG, GPIO, I2C/I3C, and DDR interfaces.
• Unix and Windows proficiency Transferable Experience in Semiconductors: Requires some combination of expertise in semiconductor design, architecture, product test, product engineering, semiconductor physics and/or semiconductor manufacturing.
• This is a high-visibility position and requires an individual that can lead and execute on a tight schedule.
• Work with internal teams and external partners/customers to define and release an optimal mix of SOC product variants to meet customer needs while achieving internal manufacturing and cost requirements.
• Identify thermal and electrical design requirements for SOC products and develop and optimize test programs to enable operation across the manufacturing process window.
• ) Adaptable: Ability to adjust to factors on the ground, guiding your team to deliver solutions while navigating real-time changes to business or customer requirements.
• Collaborate with hardware design engineers and other development teams to establish specifications for infrastructure required to support production test and debug.
• Deliver innovative product test solutions consisting of hardware, software, and test content to achieve cost and quality requirements of the product.
